key.desc: Open, close cowl flaps one step

PropertyList.text:
Starting the Constellation's engines:
Engage the magnetos for the engines you wish to start by setting the switches above the pilot seat to "Both". From the engineer's station, locate the "MJB No. 1" panel to the upper left. Turn on the ship's battery or ground cart battery. Turn on all generator switches. Below that panel, find the "MJB No. 2" panel. Turn the "Engine Starter Select" switch to the engine you want to start. Press "Start" and watch your gauges for the engine to catch. Repeat for all 4 engines.
________________________Procedures_________________________ Takeoff : Open cowl flaps 100%. flaps 60%. 56.5 inHg, 2900 RPM. Note: this is not full throttle! 120 KIAS (light load) or 130 KIAS (full load): rotate 165 KIAS: gear up 184 KIAS: flaps up
Climb : 48.0 inHg, 2600 RPM. Note: this is not full throttle! Cowl flaps 60% Maintain 190 KIAS. Above 3600 ft, lean mixture gradually to keep BMEP as high as possible. Open throttle gradually to maintain 48 inHg. Watch cylinder head temperature; open cowl flaps as necessary.
When throttle is wide open and manifold pressure drops below 48 inHg (approximately 9000 ft), reduce throttle and engage supercharger high speed then adjust throttle to keep 48 inHg.
Cruise : 223 KIAS at 20000 ft, 218 KIAS at 21000 ft 45 inHg, 2300 RPM. With throttle wide open, adjust RPM to control speed. Reduce RPM further as your ship becomes lighter. Close cowl flaps.
Descent : max pitch, 48.0 inHg or less as necessary. Gradually enrich mixture to keep BMEP maximized. Engage supercharger low speed below 9000 ft.
Approach : 184 KIAS: flaps 60% 165 KIAS: gear down 161 KIAS: flaps 66% 154 KIAS: flaps 80% 148 KIAS: flaps 100%
Landing : maintain 120 kt (landing load); touch down 110 kt (landing load), 100 kt (empty load).
________________________Emergency_________________________ Put out fire : At Engineer View:
Mixture lever for this engine down Throttle lever for this engine down
Restart after fire : Magnetos for this engine to both Mixture max. (or same as others) Throttle max. (or same as others) Starter switch to the engine no.... and restart with S or starter button
________________________ Performance _______________________ Ceiling : 23500 ft Normal cruise : 280 KTAS (223 KIAS) @ 20000 ft Range : 3800 nmi
_______________________ Speed limits _______________________ Vne (never exceed) : 294 KIAS until 12500 ft; then - 10 KIAS / 2000 ft Vno (normal operation): 261 KIAS until 12500 ft, then - 10 KIAS / 2000 ft Va (maneuvering) : 193 KIAS Vlo (landing gear operation) : 165 KIAS Vle (landing gear extension) : 165 KIAS Vf (flaps): take-off 60%: 195 KIAS approach 66%: 174 KIAS final 80%: 174 KIAS landing 100%: 165 KIAS
________________________ Engine limits _____________________ Maximum take-off power: 2900 rpm, 3250 hp 2 minutes at sea level : 56.5 inHg 5 minutes at 7500 ft : 53.5 inHg
Maximum continuous power: 2600 rpm sea level: 49.0 inHg, 2700 hp 5800 ft: 47.0 inHg, 2750 hp 10050 ft: 48.5 inHg, 2400 hp 16400 ft: 47.0 inHg, 2450 hp
Maximum cylinder head temperature: 270 degC, 550 degF
________________________ Weight limits _____________________ See Equipment > Fuel and payload. The center of gravity must lie within the following limits:
At 137500 lbs: between 671.3 and 685.2 inches aft of the nose At 90000 lbs: between 660.5 and 685.2 inches aft of the nose
